sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: it's uncovered a mass grave that could contain hundreds of its soldiers and civilians in the eastern town of Izum recently liberated by Ukrainian forces. And after a massive drop in tourism due to the pandemic, foreign visitors are returning to Turkey but hospitality businesses are facing different challenges.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The village of Pianello di Ostra in central Italy has been left for ruin.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Torrential rain and overnight floods have claimed the lives of at least 10 people in the Marche region.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Four others are missing, including two children.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Residents in the town of Senigallia are also reeling after the Misa River burst its banks.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Mud, floodwater and debris now fill the streets. The worst hit area was Ancona, a port city on the Adriatic Sea, where 400 millilitres of rain fell within two to three hours. The neighbouring region of Umbria was also affected. Several municipalities are now without power and clean drinking water, while authorities say schools in affected areas will remain closed until Monday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: More than 300 firefighters were dispatched in a widespread rescue mission.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Some waded waist-deep through the water, while others steered rubber dinghies through the flooded streets, putting trapped residents to safety.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Firefighters reportedly saved a woman whose car was swept away by the floods in the town of Barbara.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: However rescue services have failed to locate her son who was separated from his mother's arms by the torrents.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The mayor of Barbara has described the downpours as a tsunami.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Prime Minister Mario Draghi's office says he will visit the Marka region later today to oversee relief efforts with the local authorities.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Ukrainian authorities say they have found a mass grave

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: close to the recently recaptured town of Izium in the Kharkiv region.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: A makeshift wooden headstone indicates that the bodies of 17 Ukrainian soldiers are buried in this forest. But the Ukrainian commissioner for missing persons says there is evidence of hundreds of bodies, including civilians.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: We want the world to know what is really happening and what the Russian occupation has led to.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Bucha, Mariupol and now, unfortunately, Izium. Russia leaves death everywhere and must be responsible for it. The world must hold Russia accountable for this war. We will do everything for this. Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky has also said that investigations into the mass grave have begun.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Russian forces left Izium last week and other parts of the Kharkiv region after a massive Ukrainian counteroffensive.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The Russian city of Skov is home to twin anti-war activists, Izaveta and Anastasia Grigoryeva.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Their father Grigoryev, a military man, has served President Putin's army in Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: While he left the battlefield for health reasons mid-June, investigators have placed his unit near the town of Bucha in March, where Kievan human rights activists say Russian troops committed a litany of war crimes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: This is what I remember.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: My father once told me, I am a military man, you go to opposition rallies.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Do you understand that sooner or later there will be a situation where you will be on the other side to me and I will point a weapon at you?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: I feel enormous guilt for all Ukrainians.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: I feel sorry that they have to go through all of this all the time.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: All these military offenses, the war in the country, the destroyed homes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: While Moscow denies harming civilians, what it maintains is a special military operation, the twins' family is now one of many in Russia that has been split over political and ideological issues.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: After 20 years of service, Grigoryev is stepping down from his duties, but according to new legislation he could face jail time if he speaks publicly about his experiences in Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The U.S. Department of State confirmed that last Wednesday,

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Italy's Prime Minister Mario Draghi had a telephone conversation with U.S. Secretary of State Blinken, a conversation that over here has been highlighted as quite significant, as according to reports in the Italian media, Draghi asked Blinken whether or not any Italian politicians or political parties have been funded by Moscow. A request that comes just days after a new U.S. intelligence report suggested that Moscow has given more than $300 million to foreign parties in over 20 countries since 2014. Blinken, according to those reports, said that Italian parties are not included in that list. But clearly, with just a few days to go of Italy's intelligence and security agency to discuss the matter. We know also that several investigations have been launched to look into possible links between Mattos Savini's leak party and Moscow since 2019 when a recording was leaked suggesting such links. Mattos Savini recently said that he has never requested nor has ever received money from Moscow.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: A similar statement has been released by Giorgio Meloni, the leader of Brothers of Italy, who could become Italy's next prime minister.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: And although the electoral campaign has not yet been affected by such evidence, it has been suggested, though, that this could be just the beginning, as more reports are expected to be released in the next few weeks.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Giorgio Orlandi for Euronews in Rome.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Tourism in Turkey is rebounding. After a massive drop due to the COVID-19 pandemic, foreign visitors are a major source of income for Nico Valdez's fish restaurant on the shore of Istanbul's Bosphorus Strait. But it's facing some different challenges this year.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: We have a big problem with credit cards. Russian people coming to the restaurant want to use their credit cards to pay, but they don't work. I'm not happy about it, and nor am I, I guess.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: It's a difficult situation for Russians Russian tourists continue to come to Turkey while the EU is tightening rules around them that's after Ukraine's government urged the EU and the g7 to ban them Ukraine's foreign ministry didn't respond to request for comment from your news about whether Turkey should do the same Turkey has played a unique role in the war in Ukraine both providing drones to Ukraine while also maintaining a relationship with Russia especially a financial one. This is the yacht believed to belong to Dmitry Kamenchik on Turkey's popular southern coast. It's one of several yachts owned by Russian oligarchs reported to have docked in Turkey following Western sanctions on Russia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The U.S. warned in August there was a risk of penalties for Turkish companies if they worked with sanctioned individuals.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Ankara dismissed the concerns, stating it would improve trade with its neighbors while not going against sanctions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: not going against sanctions. Any business Turkey can get is vital for its embattled economy that is now seeing an official inflation rate of more than 80 percent. That has put major strain on Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan's popularity. Economist John Selcuky said tourism revenue is especially important this season as Erdogan is set to face his most difficult election next year.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Given the macroeconomics in Turkey right now and the dire need for any kind of exchange currency in Turkey, I would say that Russian tourists are very important.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: For Valdez, he says Russians account for about half of his business.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: We have a very bad economy, but Russian tourists coming here means we can earn money, which is good.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Christina Jovanovsky, Euronews, Istanbul.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Anna Jovanovski, Euronews, Istanbul.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The Metropolitan Police Force says two officers were hospitalised after being stabbed in central London.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The attack occurred around the Leicester Square area, around 6am local time.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: A man in his 20s was arrested on suspicion of causing grievous bodily harm and assaulting an emergency worker. Police do not believe the attack was motivated by terrorism or linked to the event relating to the death of the Queen.
